item.title: Duplicate identifier 'x'?
item.dc:creator: @bullzeye95 bullzeye
item.description:
@bullzeye95 wrote:

You have to use it like [scar]
begin
repeat
findcolors;
until(false);
End.[/scar]
You have to put an Until(false if you want it to go forever) after a repeat, just like an end; after a begin.

Read full topic

at the very last line it says unknown identifier at the word “end.”
and i take out end and it says unexpected end of file

this is the last thing i need help with i promise

item.title: Duplicate identifier 'x'?
item.dc:creator: @driger1592 driger1592
item.description:
@driger1592 wrote:

Easy fix. You see, x and y are already global variables in SRL.scar (which you included), so the solution is easy In your script, take the two lines out that read:

Var x,y : Integer;
And you’re set

Read full topic

item.title: Duplicate identifier 'x'?
item.dc:creator: @junior junior
item.description:
@junior wrote:

this is the first script i amd making and i just started it, i am planing on making a willow cutter.
im only up to the finding color procedures and having a problem.
(note the willow color is NOT the right color)
i get this “Line 7: [Error] (14816:1): Duplicate identifier ‘x’ in script”
please help me on it.

[scar]program colors;
{.include SRL/SRL.scar}
{.include SRL/SRL/skill/woodcutting.scar}

Var
x,y : Integer;
const
Willowcolor=1587678

Procedure findcolors;
begin
Findcolorspiral(x,y,Willowcolor,5,5,515,340)
wait(5000)
mouse(x,y,1,1,true)
end;

begin
repeat
findcolors
End.

[/scar]

Read full topic
